embeds.title: Mob Leader's Staff
embeds.description:
Starter Relic / The Gremlins / Downfall

At the start of each combat, gain :e_gremlin: , draw 1 card, and Swap to the next Gremlin.
*Among gremlin mobs, the one with the best horn maintains complete command over the troupe, until another one manages to steal it.*

messages.content: draw and energy simple
bulk up atleast is persistent block
bulk up is temp hp
yes
but its not good enough to warrant having enough in your deck to make swapping to fat grem t1 consistent
idk I'd be willing to lose consistency for the turn 1 benefit
but that's probably just me

Having strong turn 1's is so incredibly valuable in StS, and this relic lets you do exactly that. I do know that some people really like boss swapping this, in order to get rid of the downside of being forced to swap your gremlins at the start of each fight. Personally, I think the benefits of mob leader's staff far outweigh the downside, and that it gives you a tremendously strong early game, all the way into the second part of act 2. It does become more of a problem later, as synergies start to really shape up, and you have 1 or 2 gremlins that are really important to keep in the front for their bonuses. Even so, each gremlin has a common that puts them into the front to help with that issue, and while they aren't all great cards, they are serviceable, and not too hard to find. Alternatively, you can lean into the swapping strategy with conga line, party stick, and enthusiasm, and play a more value oriented deck where you don't care about the downside. If you do choose to keep mob leader's staff, and end up in a deck focused on 1 to 2 gremlins, you do have some control over the downside. Using tag team+ or other swap cards, you can specifically end fights as the gremlin just before your desired one whenever you can afford to stall a fight out, creating a weird but interesting mini game in between fights, sort of like with counting relics like incense burner, happy flower, or pen nib. In my opinion, the upside of the staff is so high that I am very willing to work with it and dominate the early game. You should have plenty of time to find late game solutions to keep your most important gremlins in the front, and can use the staff to snowball and take down several elites.

Boss swapping is also just high variance in general, especially for gremlins, where busted crown can make assembling synergies very difficult, coffee dripper can completely shut of gremlin revival, runic dome can hide deadly multihits that will kill multiple gremlin, and snecko eye and velvet choker are very rough with their cheap card spam synergies You also still have the generally awful ectoplasm. I really don't like taking a big risk like that and potentially tanking my equity
Gremlin leaders voucher is also a really rough hit

Boss swap ftw. Unless you hit coffee dripper or velvet choker your fine, basically everything else is usable for gremlins; crown is kinda rough but just taking 4 fights and taking all 4 cards is usually going to give you a deck that can kill an elite (gremlins only have like 2 cards that are not good and even those are still playable).
Not that you should boss swap every single run, its just a good idea most of the time. Other things like remove or transform 2 are better for grems
Ah yes boss swap into voucher and just lose an important gremlin at the start of game
Sounds great
ya thats not ideal but its floor 0 and the runs still perfectly winnable
Tbh if you get du vu doll on gremlins than you win the game
Seeking for that relic will make your life so easy
And in cases like that the extra draw is worth it
most gremlin decks end up only focusing on 2 or sometimes just 1 gremlin by the end of the game; so losing a gremlin forever hurts because you lose cannon fodder but its not a game loss.
I mean losing fat or shield for mitigation reasons is actually pretty horrible
The rest is fine to go though
I suppose it depends on how you play gremlins
It's kinda odd right cause the extra draw on turn one is huge for securing kills the swap highly depends on circumstance

Weird question, what is the order for gremlins? In the context of mob leaders staff (and a few cards I believe), some say to swap to the next gremlin. Is there a specific order that they are always in, can it change in some way? Is it just the order they start the run in?
When you swap it sends that gremlin to the back
So in theory if you had enough <patsy> or <rythym> you could get to the gremlin you want by the next combat
